result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Salad A Ahmed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Abdallah A Ahmed in court.  Attorney Michael F. Bishop in court for Abdallah A Ahmed.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for jury trial. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Abdallah A Ahmed in court.  Attorney Michael F. Bishop in court for Abdallah A Ahmed.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Final pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. Jury trial scheduled for 10-17-2022 at 9:00 am , Branch 15.

Defense counsel contacted the Court requesting an adjournment due to medical reasons. Court grants the request. Parties advised of the new date and time. Case remains calendared in Br 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Of Potential Conflict, filed by Attorney Bishop.
Defendant Salad A Ahmed in court with attorney Michael F. Bishop.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Salad A Ahmed in court with attorney .  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Case in court on defense motion to modify no contact order. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Hearing on no contact order  proceeded.   Arguments heard by defense and the State.  Statement made by the victim. 
Court GRANTED  defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record.  Defense request final pretrial and jury trial dates
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-03-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AAA.

Defendant Salad A Ahmed in court with attorney Michael F. Bishop.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-1-2022 @2:30p
